comments.author: Kendall Coachman

comments.text:
Yeah, you have to remember what a nightmare the Bush years were like for 
our country. It's very strange to look back on it now, if you're old enough 
to remember what it was like. Emotions got the better of us after 9/11, and 
the world saw that. Bush and his all the evil corporate scumbags and 
defense contractors were foaming at the mouth with dollar signs in their 
eyes in the aftermath of 9/11. I think the narrative that George W. Bush is 
stupid was played up a little bit. Was he a genius, among the absolute best 
and brightest that our nation has to offer? Of course not. But he knew what 
was expected of him. He knew for whom he was really working, and it was 
convenient for those in power to have the public think of him as a harmless 
simpleton.

comments.text:
Cenk and Ben started the show thinking it would be, in their words, "half 
politics, half J-Lo's ass". But then the Iraq War happened and they 
couldn't focus on "J-Lo" as much, but still that has always been the spirit 
of TYT. They are not uptight robots with sticks up their asses and they 
(well, mostly Cenk) like light-hearted stories to counter all the political 
depressing shit. They mostly cover those kinds of stories with enough 
substance to talk about larger social issues. Sometimes they don't. There's 
nothing wrong with that and you can always skip videos you don't like.

comments.author: YawnGod

comments.text:
Do a survey today, and about the same amount of Americans now think Bush 
had more to do with 9/11 than Hussein.
I don't think Bush plans much more than putting the clothes on that his 
wife chose for him. Best case scenario he was incompetent or negligent for 
ignoring the memo's. People tried to sweep that under the rug, but if 
something reaches the importance of being brought to the president's 
attention, there was a reason. It's reason was scapegoat.
Cole wasn't that long before, a memo stating the guy who did it is planning 
an attack, and instead of increasing security and investigations, there are 
several points where agents were informing superiors of things going on and 
them being taken off whatever they were on, and nothing being done. John P 
O'Neill, being the most prominent, and ironic.
But to claim the biggest, intelligence gathering machine, the American 
military industrial complex were caught with their pants down is ludicrous.
One of the biggest clues is their behaviour after.
The saddest part was watching all these people so opposed to the invasive 
reaction of Bush, snuggled up to it under Obama, the newest face, on the 
exact same product.
The true irony is watching two groups who can't look at history and see 
themselves. There is nothing new under the sun. People are people as they 
have always been people. This next line is likely to send most of this 
crowd into a tizzy, but it can't be helped. If it makes your head explode 
you might want to ask yourself why the vitriolic reaction? Rhetorically of 
course.
But the earliest ancient text, (blah blah Sumerian, Torah wasn't written 
until after Moses died, but was wrote by what was wrote before it. 
According to it, every prominent character overlaps creating the 
possibility of a clear passed down geneology Not sure but "those" people, 
keep immaculate records.) lol, I can just hear you screaming at the screen 
in a useless rant.
But I digress, substantially, but the earliest text, has 1/4 of the 
population as murderers. The known secular history of man isn't any better. 
Just better ways of killing more. That's where most technology is advanced. 
Do you think they developed it so you can text mindlessly back and forth, 
and find a restaurant?
Anyways, just pointing out that since man starting taking down it's 
history, people look at it, and because it isn't them, they can't see they 
are just the next contestants, so they play.
One group not realizing they are the oppressed, soon to be written about in 
the history books, and the other the oppressor who never learns crime 
doesn't pay.
Every single totalitarian regime, except the ones operating today, are dead 
and gone in usually bloody massacres. They never go away quietly into the 
night.
There is a section in that book, that speaks about a place called Babylon. 
They tried to create a one world rule. It is the first in that list of 
those people who don't understand crime doesn't pay, in the long run.
And ever since that place was destroyed, there has been a repeated 
behaviour by some who try to take over the world and create a one world 
system.
We are going to try it again, but it looks like this will be the last one.
Don't make any long term plans, unless they are eternal long term plans, 
and I fear that it is a must and urgent.
Get your affairs in order, it's about to get bumpy.
My personal advice, get one of those free parachutes offered by that book. 
It will make the landing softer, and will install eyes that see, and it 
won't look so scary when it happens.﻿

I mean Cenk is one of the fake opposition people. Talks the talk but it's 
BS.

1) Afghanistan didn't have anything to do with 9/11 either but Cenk isn't 
ranting about that.

2) Cenk talks in a way that is really just nonsense. Firings? People are 
fired by their bosses. Firings suggest they aren't doing exactly what their 
bosses want.

The framework of this rant is so far in left field it almost doesn't bear a 
response. Almost.
comments.author: Ingemar Kenyatta

comments.text:
+Ingemar Kenyatta Cenk wants them fired for the 43% that didn't know Iraq 
wasn't involved in the 9/11 attacks.
comments.author: Glenn Jerome Everette

comments.text:
Why should the reporters be fired? 
And by whom? 
Aren't they working for editors that would have to do this firing?

comments.text:

involved in they 9/11 attacks? Cenk blames the MSM and rails against them 
for not doing their job. I think his best line was went sorta like:  "Jesus 
died 2000 years ago but he's been on the cover of Time 88 times since 
9/11." LOL.

comments.author: Jeannie Weannie

comments.text:
LOVE THIS.  All these years later Cenk has proven himself justified in his 
outrage.  TYT and online news programs like them are our only hope.
 TV & Print news is dead.﻿
comments.author: chetzmom

comments.text:
I am a moderate fan of TYT and although they are a bit too liberal for me, 
I have to admit that this was right on the money. Propaganda by the news 
stations, in this day and age of the Internet, gets tiresome. We get our 
news from multiple sources these days and it's clear that we use as much 
propaganda as anybody. It's a bitter pill to swallow when you realize that 
we are no different than those whom we judge.﻿
comments.author: thelordmemnoch

comments.text:
+Rhys Hopkins That's because today there is no answer. Everybody has more 
than just a slant; is a straight-up bias. You truly do have to watch every 
station just to see if you can decipher the truth for yourself. I try to 
watch news about America from outside sources as well. That at least gives 
you a feeling of what they think about us and it's not pretty. Almost all 
the Europeans I have come across can't believe that Fox News is even 
allowed on television because of it's propensity to distort facts and 
manipulate the news. I watch most of the "news" for the lulz than for 
actual news.
comments.author: thelordmemnoch

comments.text:
I have heard that the American media has a "liberal bias" but when I ask 
"What is the best station, show or person to watch to get the facts from?" 
I don't really get a straight answer, so for the most part I end up 
trusting The Daily Show and Real Time with Bill Maher and avoiding Fox 
News/Rush Limbaugh/Glen Beck.
comments.author: Rhys Hopkins
